moves.10... Nbd7 11. exf6 Bb7 12. g3 c5 13. d5: Not the main line (13...Qb6 is the most common response), but certainly an acceptable one.
moves.14. Bg2 Bh6 15. Bh4: In opening study I have briefly looked at this possibility. It appears Awkward, but is actually not a bad choice; it is just not commonly played. To stifle my curiousity, I checked the game databases here on GameKnot. It has, apparently, never been played in any of their "world" database games; and only been played once here on GameKnot- a drawn game against the top gameknot player Cyrano.
moves.15... Bg7 16. O-O Rxh4: Definately black's best move; he get's attacking play.
moves.17. gxh4 Nxd5: we break from all GK recorded theory here.. autumnrains-cyrano sees 17... b4
moves.18. Qg4 Bxc3 19. bxc3 Qc7 20. Bxd5: This may not have been my best option, as the bishop points a laser into my kingside. But removing the knight allows me to activate my rooks and thrust my a-pawn nicely with tempo.
This line leads to the forced draw by repetition. Black has perpetual, and his king is in too much danger for him not to use it.
moves.26. bxa6+ Ka7 27. f3 Rg7+ 28. Kh1 Qf4 29: Clearly, Kings are too exposed for anything else to happen in this game.
